'''John Joseph Corbett Jr.''' (born May 9, 1961)<ref name=Baseline>{{cite web|title=John Corbett|url=https://movies.nytimes.com/person/534334/John-Corbett|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080115111416/http://movies.nytimes.com/person/534334/John-Corbett|url-status=dead|archive-date=January 15, 2008|department=Movies & TV Dept.|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=2008|access-date=February 11, 2011}}</ref> is an American actor and [[country music]] singer. On television, he is best known for his roles as [[Chris Stevens (Northern Exposure)|Chris Stevens]] on ''[[Northern Exposure]]'' (1990â€“1995), [[Aidan Shaw]] on ''[[Sex and the City]]'' (2000â€“2003), Max Gregson on ''[[United States of Tara]]'' (2009â€“2011), and Seth Holt on ''[[Parenthood (2010 TV series)|Parenthood]]'' (2011â€“2015). In film, he is known for roles in the ''[[My Big Fat Greek Wedding (franchise)|My Big Fat Greek Wedding]]'' franchise, ''[[Raising Helen]]'' (2004), ''[[The Messengers (film)|The Messengers]]'' (2007), ''[[Sex and the City 2]]'' (2010), ''[[Ramona & Beezus]]'' (2010), and the ''[[To All the Boys (franchise)|To All the Boys]]'' film trilogy (2018â€“2021). 

In addition to acting, Corbett has pursued a career in country music, releasing the studio albums ''[[John Corbett (album)|John Corbett]]'' (2006) and ''Leaving Nothin' Behind'' (2013) with the former reaching number 45 on the [[Top Country Albums|''Billboard'' Country Albums]] chart.

==Early life==
Corbett was raised in [[Wheeling, West Virginia]], U.S.<ref>{{cite web|last=Comins|first=Linda|title=Wheeling Native John Corbett Secures Hometown Opening For Film|url=http://www.theintelligencer.net/news/community/2017/08/wheeling-native-john-corbett-secures-hometown-opening-for-film/|website=[[The Intelligencer and Wheeling News Register]]|date=August 24, 2017}}</ref> He grew up in an apartment block near the Ohio River with his mother and stepfather, both of whom worked at his uncle Phillip's music club.<ref>{{cite web|last=Woods|first=Eric|title=John Corbett combines acting with lifelong love of music|url=http://lubbockonline.com/entertainment/2011-03-04/john-corbett-combines-acting-lifelong-love-music#.UpnSEuKHiDc|website=[[Lubbock Avalanche-Journal]]|access-date=November 30, 2013|date=March 4, 2011}}</ref> Corbett was raised [[Catholic]], and was an [[altar server|altar boy]] for seven years at [[Cathedral of Saint Joseph (Wheeling, West Virginia)|St. Joseph's Cathedral]].<ref name="Guideposts">{{cite web|last=Corbett|first=John|url=https://www.guideposts.org/better-living/entertainment/movies-and-tv/john-corbett-the-importance-of-saying-yes|title=John Corbett: The Importance of Saying Yes|website=[[Guideposts]]|date=July 18, 2017}}</ref> His father was raised in [[Bellaire, Ohio]], and was a member of the [[Jehovah's Witnesses]].<ref name=nbca1>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/think/opinion/hollywood-makes-lots-movies-about-god-more-heavy-handed-any-ncna861611|title=Opinion | John Corbett: Faith-based movies aren't really new in Hollywood|website=NBC News|date=April 2018 |quote=I was raised Catholic and I was an altar boy, though my father was a Jehovah's Witness and my mother was Jewish. }}</ref><ref name="RiverfrontTimes">{{cite web|last=Babka|first=Allison|title=Get To Know Singer/Actor John Corbett Before Tonight's Show at The Gramophone|url=http://blogs.riverfronttimes.com/rftmusic/2013/10/five_questions_with_singeracto.php|quote=Without Bellaire, Ohio, I wouldn't be here -- that's where my father's from! I lived five blocks from the Capitol Music Hall in Wheeling and worked there.|website=[[Riverfront Times]]|access-date=November 30, 2013|date=October 9, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203044258/http://blogs.riverfronttimes.com/rftmusic/2013/10/five_questions_with_singeracto.php?page=2|archive-date=December 3, 2013|url-status=dead}}</ref> Corbett's mother was [[Jewish]] through her father who was of [[Russian-Jewish]] descent.<ref name=nbca1/><ref>{{cite web|last=Johnson|first=Neala|url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/entertainment/movies/john-corbett-the-big-fat-greek-husband-nia-vardalos-went-to-the-ends-of-the-earth-to-find/news-story/5b61d82aae8766df9417a4d3781aa2cb|title=John Corbett: the Big Fat Greek husband Nia Vardalos went to the ends of the earth to find|website=The Herald Sun|date=March 19, 2016|quote=I didnâ€™t have a father growing up; he split when I was about two. So I was raised by two strong women who thought I was the funniest and cutest kid in the world: my mum Sandy, and her mother, who was a Great Russian Jewish woman named Eldoris.}}</ref><ref name=refi1>{{cite web|last=Brasher|first=Joan|title=John Corbett|url=http://www.thefish.com/movies/features/11621912/John-Corbett/|website=The Fish|access-date=February 11, 2011}}</ref>

Corbett started playing the guitar at age seven, and at 16, he worked as a security guard at the [[Capitol Music Hall]].<ref>{{cite web|title=John Corbett: 'City' man goes country|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1320&dat=20060714&id=qt1WAAAAIBAJ&pg=1410,3005985|website=[[Gainesville Sun]]|access-date=November 30, 2013|date=July 14, 2006}}</ref> He attended [[Wheeling Central Catholic High School]], from which he graduated in 1979.<ref>{{cite web|last=Vaughn|first=Cliff|title=Actor John Corbett Remembers Teachers' Influence|url=http://www.ethicsdaily.com/actor-john-corbett-remembers-teachers-influence-cms-4811|website=EthicsDaily.com|date=October 6, 2004}}</ref>

Following his graduation from high school, Corbett moved to [[Bellflower, California]] to live with his father and stepmother, and worked for [[Kaiser Steel]] in [[Fontana, California|Fontana]] for six years.<ref name="Guideposts"/><ref>{{cite web|last=Furlong|first=Maggie|title=John Corbett On 'A Smile As Big As The Moon,' Playing Mike Kersjes And Why He Almost Wasn't An Actor|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/01/28/john-corbett-a-smile-as-big-as-the-moon_n_1235484.html|website=[[HuffPost]]|access-date=November 30, 2013|date=January 28, 2012}}</ref> During his time as a hydrotester in the factory, he spent a year training to become an [[Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department|L.A. County Deputy Sheriff]], but ultimately failed the exams.<ref>{{cite web|last=Murray|first=Rebecca|title=Keanu Reeves, John Corbett, Amaury Nolasco and Jay Mohr Talk 'Street Kings'|url=http://movies.about.com/od/streetkings/a/streetking40408.htm|website=[[About.com]]. [[The New York Times Company]]|access-date=November 30, 2013|date=April 7, 2008|archive-date=July 31, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170731033513/http://movies.about.com/od/streetkings/a/streetking40408.htm|url-status=dead}}</ref> Corbett stopped working at the factory after injuring his back; he subsequently enrolled in hairdressing classes at [[Cerritos College]] in [[Norwalk, California|Norwalk]], and also studied acting there.<ref name="LATimes">{{cite web|last=Matsumoto|first=Jon|title=John Corbett Plays With The Paranormal As Fox's 'The Visitor'|url=https://www.latimes.com/archives/la-xpm-1997-sep-14-tv-31985-story.html|website=[[Los Angeles Times]]|access-date=November 30, 2013|date=September 14, 1997}}</ref> Corbett said, "I went to hair school by day and studied theatre at night."<ref>{{cite web|last=Romanek|first=Bethany A.|title=John Corbett Finds Peace of Mind in Ohio Valley|url=http://home.comcast.net/~mcnotes/CorbettPeace.html|archive-url=http://webarchive.loc.gov/all/20061001200905/http://home.comcast.net/%7Emcnotes/CorbettPeace.html|url-status=dead|archive-date=October 1, 2006|website=The Intelligencer Wheeling News Register|access-date=November 30, 2013|date=January 15, 2006}}</ref> He has been a licensed hair stylist since 1986.<ref name="RiverfrontTimes"/> He then landed a [[Samsung]] commercial, and after three years, had starred in 50 national commercials.<ref>{{cite web|last=Johnson|first=Kevin C.|title=Corbett doesn't mind being billed as the guy from 'Sex and the City'|url=https://www.stltoday.com/entertainment/music/corbett-doesn-t-mind-being-billed-as-the-guy-from/article_c9748a46-5a77-5c19-9ae5-728123c52146.html|website=[[St. Louis Post-Dispatch]]|access-date=November 30, 2013|date=October 3, 2013}}</ref>

==Career==

===Acting===
[[File:John Corbett.jpg|right|thumb|Corbett at the [[44th Primetime Emmy Awards]] in August 1992]]
Corbett's first role came in 1988, when he was cast as Louis, the hippie boyfriend of Karen Arnold ([[Olivia d'Abo]]) in the first season of [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]]'s comedy-drama series ''[[The Wonder Years]]''. For this appearance, he was credited as Jack Corbett. From 1990 to 1995, he starred as Chris Stevens in the [[CBS]] comedy-drama series ''[[Northern Exposure]]'', for which he was nominated for the [[Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actor â€“ Series, Miniseries or Television Film]] and the [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Drama Series]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Hastings|first=Deborah|title='Northern Exposure' And NBC Lead The Pack For 44th Emmy Awards|url=https://www.chicagotribune.com/1992/07/16/northern-exposure-and-nbc-lead-the-pack-for-44th-emmy-awards/|website=[[Chicago Tribune]]|date=July 16, 1992}}</ref>

Corbett played the leading role of Adam MacArthur, in 1997's short-lived [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] science fiction series ''[[The Visitor (TV series)|The Visitor]]'', for which he was nominated for the [[Saturn Award for Best Actor on Television]]. His character, who was abducted by [[Extraterrestrial life|aliens]], finds his way back to Earth 50 years later, endowed with special powers. From 2001 to 2002, he portrayed the love interest of [[Carrie Bradshaw]] ([[Sarah Jessica Parker]]), Aidan Shaw, in the [[HBO]] comedy series ''[[Sex and the City]]'',<ref>{{cite web|last=Wethington|first=Jessica|title=Emmy performers: John Corbett|url=https://variety.com/2001/tv/awards/emmy-performers-john-corbett-1117800878/|website=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=June 6, 2001}}</ref> for which he received his second nomination for the [[Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actor â€“ Series, Miniseries or Television Film]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Golden Globes: 2002 winners in full|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/1721758.stm|website=[[BBC News]]|date=December 20, 2001}}</ref>
In 2001 he also had a supporting role in the romantic comedy film ''Serendipity'', starring John Cusack.{{cn|date=September 2023}} In 2002, Corbett portrayed the male lead role of Ian Miller in the romantic comedy film ''[[My Big Fat Greek Wedding]]'', alongside [[Nia Vardalos]] (who also wrote the screenplay), for which he was nominated for a [[Screen Actors Guild Award]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/chicago-nabs-5-nods-from-sag/|title='Chicago' Nabs 5 Nods From SAG|website=[[CBS News]]|first=Jaime|last=Holguin|date=January 28, 2003}}</ref>

In 2003, he starred in the [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] dark comedy series ''[[Lucky (American TV series)|Lucky]]'', as professional [[poker]] player Michael "Lucky" Linkletter. The following year, he starred alongside [[Kate Hudson]] in [[Garry Marshall]]'s comedy-drama film ''[[Raising Helen]]''. He then portrayed music teacher Mr. Torvald in the 2004 musical drama film ''[[Raise Your Voice]]'', co-starring [[Hilary Duff]]. Three years later, he had a starring role in the [[Pang brothers]] horror film ''[[The Messengers (film)|The Messengers]]'' (2007).<ref>{{cite press release|url=https://www.sony.com/en_us/SCA/company-news/press-releases/columbia-pictures/2005/pang-brothers-and-ghost-house-announce-casting-of-.html|title=Pang Brothers and Ghost House Announce Casting of Untitled Pang Brothers Project|website=[[Sony Pictures]]|date=June 29, 2005|access-date=August 30, 2017|archive-date=August 30, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170830234350/https://www.sony.com/en_us/SCA/company-news/press-releases/columbia-pictures/2005/pang-brothers-and-ghost-house-announce-casting-of-.html|url-status=dead}}</ref> Additionally, Corbett starred in the 2007 [[Lifetime (TV network)|Lifetime]] television film ''[[Montana Sky]]'', and co-starred as a corrupt LAPD vice squad member in the 2008 [[David Ayer]]-directed crime thriller ''[[Street Kings]]''. The following year, he reunited with his ''My Big Fat Greek Wedding'' co-star Nia Vardalos for the romantic comedy ''[[I Hate Valentine's Day]]'' (2009), which Vardalos also wrote and directed.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/nia-vardalos-john-corbett-rekindle-111682|title=Nia Vardalos, John Corbett rekindle romance|website=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|first=Gregg|last=Goldstein|date=May 14, 2008}}</ref> In 2009, he also co-starred in the [[Brian Herzlinger]]-directed comedy film ''[[Baby on Board (film)|Baby on Board]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/baby-boom-graham-oconnell-cast-104926|title='Baby' boom: Graham, O'Connell among cast|website=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|first=Gregg|last=Goldstein|date=February 14, 2008}}</ref>

From 2009 to 2011, Corbett co-starred in the [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]] comedy-drama series ''[[United States of Tara]]'' as Max Gregson, the husband of [[Toni Collette]]'s title character.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/corbett-joins-tara-pilot-107325|title=Corbett joins 'Tara' pilot|website=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|first=Nellie|last=Andreeva|date=March 19, 2008}}</ref> In 2010, Corbett reprised his role as Aidan Shaw in the ''Sex and the City'' feature film sequel ''[[Sex and the City 2]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.accesshollywood.com/articles/john-corbett-admits-aidan-shaw-is-in-sex-and-the-city-2-83707/|title=John Corbett Admits Aidan Shaw Is In 'Sex And The City 2'|website=[[Access Hollywood]]|date=March 25, 2010}}</ref> That same year, he starred as Tom Marks in the [[Hallmark Channel|Hallmark]] seasonal television film ''[[November Christmas]]'', alongside [[Sam Elliott]] and [[Sarah Paulson]], and portrayed Robert Quimby in [[Elizabeth Allen Rosenbaum]]'s family comedy film ''[[Ramona and Beezus]]'', based on the [[Ramona (novel series)|''Ramona'' novel series]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/trio-book-roles-ramona-80188|title=Trio book roles in 'Ramona'|website=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|first1=Borys|last1=Kit|first2=Jay A.|last2=Fernandez|date=March 3, 2009}}</ref> Corbett was inducted into the [[Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences]] in June 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.backstage.com/bso/content_display/news-and-features/e3i127e41ca0992fb7a7e1c5ec3f0aad28a|title=Academy Invites 178 Artists and Execs as New Members|website=[[Backstage (magazine)|Backstage]]|first=Gregg|last=Kilday|date=March 3, 2009}}</ref>

[[File:John Corbett by Gage Skidmore.jpg|right|thumb|Corbett at the San Diego Comic-Con in July 2015]]
From 2011 to 2015, he had a recurring role as Seth Holt on the NBC drama series ''[[Parenthood (2010 TV series)|Parenthood]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last=Ausiello|first=Michael|title=John Corbett Lands Arc on NBC's 'Parenthood'|url=https://www.deadline.com/2010/12/john-corbett-lands-arc-on-nbcs-parenthood/|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|access-date=November 29, 2013|date=December 17, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Ausiello|first=Michael|title=Parenthood Exclusive: John Corbett Returning For Major Arc|url=http://tvline.com/2011/08/02/parenthood-john-corbett-returning/|website=[[TVLine]]|date=August 2, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Stanhope|first=Kate|title=Parenthood Exclusive: John Corbett Books Return Appearance|url=https://www.tvguide.com/News/Parenthood-John-Corbett-Returning-1073954.aspx|website=[[TV Guide]]|access-date=November 29, 2013|date=November 26, 2013}}</ref> In March 2013, Corbett appeared in two episodes of the CBS procedural drama series ''[[NCIS: Los Angeles]]'' as Special Agent Roy Haines; it was considered to be a planted pilot episode for a [[spin-off (media)|spin-off]] series focusing on his character, but this was ultimately not produced.<ref>{{cite web|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|title=John Corbett To Star In 'NCIS: LA' Spinoff|url=https://deadline.com/2013/02/john-corbett-to-star-in-ncis-la-spinoff-423290/|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=February 6, 2013}}</ref> In 2012, he portrayed teacher Mike Kersjes in the Hallmark television film based on the memoir of the same name, ''[[A Smile as Big as the Moon]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last=Furlong|first=Maggie|title=John Corbett On 'A Smile As Big As The Moon,' Playing Mike Kersjes And Why He Almost Wasn't An Actor|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/01/28/john-corbett-a-smile-as-big-as-the-moon_n_1235484.html|website=[[HuffPost]]|date=January 28, 2012}}</ref> Corbett provided the voiceover for [[Applebee's]] television commercials and, since 2012, has been the voice for [[Walgreens]]' television and radio advertisements.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/09/17/business/media/q-and-a-with-stuart-elliott.html|title=Q. and A. with Stuart Elliott|first=Stuart|last=Elliott|website=[[The New York Times]]|date=September 17, 2012|access-date=October 8, 2012}}</ref> In 2014, Corbett appeared alongside [[Sarah Bolger]] in [[Jeff Probst]]'s drama film ''[[Kiss Me (2014 film)|Kiss Me]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/john-corbett-jeff-probst-sarah-bolger-280535|title=Jeff Probst-Directed Indie Drama to Star John Corbett and Sarah Bolger|website=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|first=Borys|last=Kit|date=January 11, 2012}}</ref> The following year, he starred as Garrett Peterson, opposite [[Jennifer Lopez]], in the [[Rob Cohen]]-directed erotic thriller ''[[The Boy Next Door (film)|The Boy Next Door]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last=Yamato|first=Jen|title=John Corbett Joins Blumhouse J. Lo Thriller 'The Boy Next Door'|url=https://deadline.com/2013/10/john-corbett-blumhouse-j-lo-the-boy-next-door-611516/|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=October 14, 2013}}</ref>

From 2015 to 2016, he portrayed Josiah "Flash" Bacon in the FX comedy series ''[[Sex & Drugs & Rock & Roll (TV series)|Sex & Drugs & Rock & Roll]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|title=John Corbett To Co-Star In Denis Leary's FX Pilot 'Sex&Drugs&Rock&Roll'|url=https://deadline.com/2014/03/john-corbett-to-co-star-in-denis-leary-fx-pilot-sexdrugsrockroll-695324/|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=March 7, 2014}}</ref> In 2016, fourteen years after ''My Big Fat Greek Wedding'' was released, Corbett returned for the sequel ''[[My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/my-big-fat-greek-wedding-707365|title=Nia Vardalos, Playtone Reuniting for 'My Big Fat Greek Wedding' Sequel|website=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|first=Borys|last=Kit|date=May 27, 2014}}</ref> In 2017, he portrayed the main role of Michael Spurlock, a pastor who welcomes [[Karen people|Karen]] [[refugee]]s to his church, in the [[Steve Gomer]]-directed drama film ''[[All Saints (film)|All Saints]]''.<ref>{{cite web|title=John Corbett & Cara Buono Talk New Movie All Saints Based Off a True Story|url=http://people.com/movies/john-corbett-cara-buono-talk-new-movie-all-saints-based-off-a-true-story/|website=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=August 21, 2017}}</ref> Corbett then had a guest starring role as himself in the eighth and final season of [[IFC (U.S. TV channel)|IFC]]'s comedy series ''[[Portlandia (TV series)|Portlandia]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.denofgeek.com/us/tv/portlandia/267452/portlandia-season-8-release-date-set-and-cast-details-revealed|title=Portlandia Season 8 Release Date Set And Cast Details Revealed|website=[[Den of Geek]]|first=Chris|last=Longo|date=September 7, 2017|access-date=September 8, 2017|archive-date=December 18, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171218105603/http://www.denofgeek.com/us/tv/portlandia/267452/portlandia-season-8-release-date-set-and-cast-details-revealed|url-status=dead}}</ref> He portrayed Dr. Dan Covey, the father of [[Lana Condor]]'s lead character, in the film adaptation of [[Jenny Han]]'s novel ''[[To All the Boys I've Loved Before (film)|To All the Boys I've Loved Before]]'' (2018), directed by [[Susan Johnson (producer)|Susan Johnson]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/john-corbett-lana-condor-join-all-boys-ive-loved-before-film-1023303|title=John Corbett, Lana Condor Join 'To All the Boys I've Loved Before' Film (Exclusive)|website=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|first=Natalie|last=Jarvey|date=July 21, 2017|access-date=July 22, 2017}}</ref> Corbett starred in ''[[God's Not Dead: A Light in Darkness]]'' (2018), as lawyer Pearce Hill.

In 2019, Corbett starred in [[John R. Leonetti]]'s film adaptation of [[Tim Lebbon]]'s horror novel ''[[The Silence (2019 film)|The Silence]]'', with [[Miranda Otto]] and [[Stanley Tucci]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://deadline.com/2017/08/miranda-otto-john-corbett-john-r-leonettis-the-silence-movie-1202157847/|title=Miranda Otto & John Corbett Cast In John R. Leonetti's 'The Silence'|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|first=Amanda|last=N'Duka|date=August 29, 2017|access-date=August 30, 2017}}</ref> He also co-starred with [[Nia Long]] in the horror sequel ''[[47 Meters Down: Uncaged]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/nia-long-corinne-foxx-topline-47-meters-down-sequel-1167870|title=Nia Long, Corinne Foxx Topline '47 Meters Down' Sequel|last=Vlessing|first=Etan|date=December 10, 2018|website=Hollywood Reporter|access-date=December 11, 2018}}</ref> In 2023 he reprised his role as Aidan Shaw in the ''Sex and the City'' reboot ''And Just Like That.''

===Music===
In 1993, Corbett starred in the [[Jeff Richter]]-directed music video for the [[Scorpions (band)|Scorpions]] single "Woman", opposite [[Karina Lombard]]. In September 2004, it was reported that Corbett had signed a recording contract with [[Nashville]]-based [[country music]] label [[Broken Bow Records]].<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Evans Price|first=Deborah|title=John Corbett Signs With Broken Bow|url=https://www.billboard.com/biz/articles/news/1427661/john-corbett-signs-with-broken-bow|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=September 30, 2004}}</ref> He released his [[John Corbett (album)|self-titled]] debut album, co-produced by D. Scott Miller and Tara Novick, on April 4, 2006,<ref>{{cite web|title=Corbett Releases Debut Album|url=http://www.cmt.com/news/1527839/corbett-releases-debut-album/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170830012320/http://www.cmt.com/news/1527839/corbett-releases-debut-album/|url-status=dead|archive-date=August 30, 2017|website=[[CMT (U.S. TV channel)|Country Music Television]]|date=April 4, 2006}}</ref> and went on tour with [[ZZ Top]], [[Lisa Marie Presley]], and [[Charlie Daniels]] to promote the record.<ref>{{cite web|title=John Corbett's new role: musician|url=https://www.today.com/popculture/john-corbett-s-new-role-musician-wbna11549462|website=[[Today (U.S. TV program)|Today.com]]|date=February 24, 2006}}</ref> The album's only single, "Good to Go", debuted at No. 48 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs]] chart, which was the highest debut by a new artist from an independent label,<ref>{{cite magazine|title=John Corbett: Actor takes a stab at the role of country music star|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/59748/john-corbett|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|access-date=November 30, 2013|date=February 8, 2006}}</ref> and later peaked at No. 43. The music video for "Good to Go" was directed by [[Kevin Kerslake]]. The album itself reached No. 45 on the Country Albums chart, and peaked at No. 21 on the [[Independent Albums]] chart.<ref>{{cite magazine|title=John Corbett â€“ Chart history|url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/304919/john-corbett/chart|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|access-date=August 29, 2017}}</ref> In 2008, Corbett was featured in [[Trisha Yearwood]]'s music video for her single "[[This Is Me You're Talking To]]".<ref name="Trisha">{{cite web|last=Darden|first=Beville|title='Sex and the City' Star Stands in for Garth Brooks|url=http://theboot.com/sex-and-the-city-star-stands-in-for-garth-brooks/|website=The Boot|date=May 28, 2008}}</ref>

Seven years after his debut, Corbett released a second country album, ''Leaving Nothin' Behind'', produced by [[Jon Randall]], on January 29, 2013.<ref>{{cite web|last=Myers|first=Jim|title=John Corbett shows love for country music on new album|url=http://blogs.tennessean.com/tunein/2013/02/28/john-corbett-shows-love-for-country-music-on-new-album/|website=[[The Tennessean]]|access-date=November 30, 2013|date=February 28, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=John Corbett releases second country album|url=http://www.express.co.uk/celebrity-news/369285/John-Corbett-releases-second-country-album|website=[[Daily Express]]|date=January 7, 2013}}</ref>

==Personal life==
Corbett was raised Catholic and "dabbled" in [[born again|born-again Christianity]] in the 1980s "before returning to his Catholic roots."<ref name="Belief in God">{{cite web|last=Savitsky|first=Sasha|title=John Corbett: I have a strong belief in God|url=http://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/2017/08/24/john-corbett-have-strong-belief-in-god.html|website=[[Fox News]]|date=August 24, 2017}}</ref> He has been in a relationship with actress [[Bo Derek]] since 2002, after meeting on a blind date.<ref>{{cite web|last=Ingrassia|first=Lisa|title=John Corbett: Sex and the Country|url=http://people.com/archive/john-corbett-sex-and-the-country-vol-73-no-20/|website=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=May 24, 2010}}</ref> They married in December 2020.<ref>{{cite tweet|number=1422643984304726017|user=TheTalkCBS|title=ðŸš¨Breaking News!ðŸš¨John Corbett reveals exclusive breaking news about his relationship with Bo Derek to the hosts, inâ€¦|date=August 3, 2021}}</ref> The couple live on a ranch in [[Santa Ynez, California]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Nepales|first=Reuben V.|title=John Corbett on life with Bo Derek, kissing Nia Vardalos anew|url=http://entertainment.inquirer.net/192509/john-corbett-on-life-with-bo-derek-kissing-nia-vardalos-anew|website=[[Inquirer.net]]|date=March 18, 2016}}</ref>
